intro: Mentzelia multicaulis, commonly known as the multiple-stemmed blazing star, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments. The plant features multiple stems that branch out from a central base, often reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its showy yellow flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Mentzelia multicaulis is known for its drought tolerance and ability to thrive in poor soil conditions.
